title: Watch: Patriots’ Will Campbell chugs beer while shirtless at Celtics game
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: New England Patriots Several of Campbell’s New England teammates cheered on the 21-year-old offensive lineman at TD Garden.
Will Campbell had himself a time at Friday’s Celtics-Heat matchup on Friday.
AP Photo/Charles Krupa Will Campbell’s knee injury isn’t preventing him from having a good time.

title: Warning issued after 2 dogs killed by coyotes in Mass. town
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News Wrentham residents are on alert after deadly coyote attacks on local dogs.
Authorities in Wrentham are warning pet owners to take precautions after coyotes killed at least two dogs in separate incidents over the past week.
In a Facebook post on Thursday, Wrentham police said both attacks occurred when dogs were left unattended in yards during overnight or early morning hours.

title: Former Patriots LB reportedly finds new home with AFC East rival
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: New England Patriots Matthew Judon was cut by another team in the division, the Dolphins, earlier this week.
Matthew Judon is reportedly joining his third career AFC East squad.
Billie Weiss/Getty Images MORE PATRIOTS A former standout Patriots defender continues to bounce around the AFC East.

title: Alex Bregman reportedly seeking 6-year deal in ‘more robust’ free-agent market than last offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Red Sox The sweepstakes for Bregman seemed to heat up this week.
Alex Bregman is one of the top free agents available this offseason.

Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff By Conor Roche December 19, 2025 | 4:37 PM 2 minutes to read If the Red Sox want to get a deal done with Alex Bregman as soon as possible, there’s at least one threshold they’ll have to meet in order for him to sign on the dotted line.

title: Flock Safety cameras helped crack the MIT and Brown case — but at what cost to privacy?
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The same technology that aided investigators has drawn criticism from residents worried about surveillance.
A Flock Safety license plate reader is seen along a public road, Thursday, Oct.

title: Marshfield presses appeal of MBTA Communities Act, arguing law is unconstitutional
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Local News The case before Massachusetts’ highest court centers on funding, zoning, and whether local votes still matter.
The MBTA Communities Act, passed in 2021, mandates cities and towns near MBTA transit stations adopt zoning laws that allow for more multi-family housing.
Staff/Photographer Jonathan Wiggs By Annie Jonas December 19, 2025 | 3:59 PM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Patriots’ defense could be without 5 starters in Sunday’s game vs. Ravens
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots Linebacker Robert Spillane has been ruled out, while other starters are listed as questionable for Sunday's matchup.
Robert Spillane didn't play a snap in the Patriots' loss to the Bills.

(Winslow Townson/AP Images for Panini) By Conor Roche December 19, 2025 | 3:45 PM 2 minutes to read The Patriots’ defense might be more than undermanned when they try to slow down two-time MVP Lamar Jackson and the Ravens on Sunday night.

title: After a concert overshadowed by tragedy, Goose steps up with fundraisers for Brown victims
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Music The Connecticut band played just minutes from Brown on the night of the shooting.
Now their auction to benefit Brown students has already raised $16K in 24 hours.
The jam band Goose, who played in Providence Saturday, are raising money for the Brown community.

title: Markey files bill to prevent cancellation of citizenship ceremonies

title: A local photographer shares images of Wassail Weekend in Vermont
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel "It really doesn’t get more Hallmark or movie set then this quaint little Vermont town.
" Wassail Weekend in Vermont.

Jackdarylphotography By Kristi Palma December 19, 2025 | 2:08 PM 1 minute to read Vermont’s annual Wassail Weekend gives off major Hallmark Christmas movie vibes, and a local photographer captured it all this season.
